description: This lovely Welsh town is located in the heart of the Teifi Valley near Carmarthen. This walk from the town explores the historic castle ruins before heading west to Cenarth where you can visit the lovely Cenarth Falls. The walk starts on the eastern side of the town at Castell Newydd Emlyn, a Norman castle dating back to the 13th century. Here you can explore the ancient ruins and the surrounding open space which includes pleasat trails along the Afon Teifi. After exploring the castle you head west through the town and out into the countryside. Here you can pick up country footpaths taking you west to Cenarth. In the village you can stand on the 18th century Cenarth Bridge and view the beautiful waterfalls and look out for the leaping salmon.
